publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-181 Dr Sylvia Jackson: Animal Welfare Centres—That the Parliament welcomes the Scottish Executive’s decision to hand all responsibility for animal welfare to its Environment and Rural Affairs Department; recognises that the Scottish Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals has been calling for such a move since 1999, and believes that this will end confusion and allow animal welfare issues to be dealt with more effectively.

S2M-181 Dr Sylvia Jackson: Animal Welfare Centres—That the Parliament welcomes the Scottish Executive’s decision to hand all responsibility for animal welfare to its Environment and Rural Affairs Department; recognises that the Scottish Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals has been calling for such a move since 1999, and believes that this will end confusion and allow animal welfare issues to be dealt with more effectively. Supported by: Christine Grahame*, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-181 Animal Welfare Centres (lodged on 19 June 2003) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-181 Animal Welfare Centres (lodged on 19 June 2003) Maureen Macmillan*
S2M-181 Animal Welfare Centres (lodged on 19 June 2003) Linda Fabiani*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-181 Animal Welfare Centres (lodged on 19 June 2003) Margaret Jamieson*
S2M-181 Animal Welfare Centres (lodged on 19 June 2003) Ms Sandra White*
S2M-181 Animal Welfare Centres (lodged on 19 June 2003) Elaine Smith*
S2M-181 Animal Welfare Centres (lodged on 19 June 2003) Scott Barrie*
